name: Chicken and Wild Mushroom Fricassee with Creamy Turnips
description: Braised chicken thighs with wild mushrooms in a rich sauce, served with creamy turnip puree.

Turnip Puree: 4 small turnips (1 1/2 lb), peeled and quartered
1 large Yukon Gold potato (8 oz), peeled and quartered

ingredients: 4 small turnips (1 1/2 lb), peeled and quartered
1 large Yukon Gold potato (8 oz), peeled and quartered
instructions: In a large cast iron casserole, heat oil until shimmering. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Working in batches, brown chicken over moderately high heat, 5 to 7 minutes. Transfer to a plate.
Add onion, carrot and celery to casserole and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned, 7 to 8 minutes.
Add garlic and mushrooms and cook 2 minutes. Stir in tomato paste and cayenne and cook, stirring, until deep mahogany, about 5 minutes.
Add wine, bay leaf and thyme and simmer for 2 minutes. Add broth and chicken and bring to a boil.
Cover and simmer over moderate heat until chicken is tender, about 1 hour.
For the turnip puree: In a medium saucepan, combine turnips and potatoes with rosemary and water to cover by 1 inch. Season with salt and bring to a boil.
Simmer vegetables over moderate heat until tender, 20-25 minutes. Drain vegetables and discard rosemary.
Transfer turnips and potato to a food processor, add cream and butter and puree until smooth. Season turnip puree with salt and pepper and keep warm.
Transfer chicken to a plate. Boil the cooking liquid until thickened and reduced to 2 1/2 cups, about 10 minutes. Discard bay leaf and thyme.
Coarsely shred the chicken and stir it into the reduced sauce, discarding skin and bones. Simmer gently until chicken is warmed through, about 2 minutes.
Serve chicken fricassee with creamy turnips.
notes: Fricassee and turnip puree can be refrigerated separately for up to 2 days. Reheat gently.
